info.description: This API empowers seamless interaction with Anytype's resourcesâ€”spaces, objects, properties, types, templates, and beyond.
info.title: Anytype API

post.description: Generates a one-time authentication challenge for granting API access to the user's vault. Upon providing a valid `app_name`, the server issues a unique `challenge_id` and displays a short code within the Anytype Desktop On success, the service returns a unique challenge ID. This challenge ID must then be used with the token endpoint (see below) to solve the challenge and retrieve an authentication token. This mechanism ensures that only trusted applications and authorized users gain access.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The name of the app requesting API access
parameters.name: app_name

200.description: The challenge ID associated with the started challenge

post.description: After receiving a challenge ID from the display_code endpoint, the client calls this endpoint to provide the corresponding 4-digit code (also via a query parameter) along with the challenge ID. The endpoint verifies that the challenge solution is correct and, if it is, returns a permanent app key. This endpoint is central to the authentication process, as it validates the user's identity and issues a token that can be used for further interactions with the API.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the challenge to solve
parameters.name: challenge_id

parameters.description: 4-digit code retrieved from Anytype Desktop app
parameters.name: code

200.description: The app key that can be used in the Authorization header for subsequent requests

post.description: Executes a global search over every space accessible by the authenticated user. The request body must specify the `query` text, optional filters on object types (e.g., "page", "task"), and sort directives (default: descending by last updated timestamp). Pagination is controlled via `offset` and `limit` query parameters to facilitate lazy loading in client UIs. The response returns a unified list of matched objects with their metadata and properties.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The number of items to return
parameters.name: limit

requestBody.description: The search parameters used to filter and sort the results

200.description: The list of objects matching the search criteria

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of all spaces that are accessible by the authenticated user. Each space record contains detailed information such as the space ID, name, icon (derived either from an emoji or image URL), and additional metadata. This endpoint is key to displaying a userâ€™s workspaces.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The number of items to return
parameters.name: limit

200.description: The list of spaces accessible by the authenticated user

post.description: Creates a new space based on a supplied name and description in the JSON request body. The endpoint is subject to rate limiting and automatically applies default configurations such as generating a random icon and initializing the workspace with default settings (for example, a default dashboard or home page). On success, the new spaceâ€™s full metadata is returned, enabling the client to immediately switch context to the new internal.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

get.description: Fetches full details about a single space identified by its space ID. The response includes metadata such as the space name, icon, and various workspace IDs (home, archive, profile, etc.). This detailed view supports use cases such as displaying space-specific settings.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space to retrieve
parameters.name: space_id

patch.description: Updates the name or description of an existing space. The request body should contain the new name and/or description in JSON format. This endpoint is useful for renaming or rebranding a workspace without needing to recreate it. The updated spaceâ€™s metadata is returned in the response.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space to update
parameters.name: space_id

post.description: Adds one or more objects to a specific list (collection only) by submitting a JSON array of object IDs. Upon success, the endpoint returns a confirmation message. This endpoint is vital for building user interfaces that allow dragâ€‘andâ€‘drop or multiâ€‘select additions to collections, enabling users to dynamically manage their collections without needing to modify the underlying object data.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space to which the list belongs
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The ID of the list to which objects will be added
parameters.name: list_id

requestBody.description: The list of object IDs to add to the list

delete.description: Removes a given object from the specified list (collection only) in a space. The endpoint takes the space, list, and object identifiers as path parameters and is subject to rate limiting. It is used for dynamically managing collections without affecting the underlying object data.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space to which the list belongs
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The ID of the list from which the object will be removed
parameters.name: list_id

parameters.description: The ID of the object to remove from the list
parameters.name: object_id

get.description: Returns a paginated list of views defined for a specific list (query or collection) within a space. Each view includes details such as layout, applied filters, and sorting options, enabling clients to render the list according to user preferences and context. This endpoint is essential for applications that need to display lists in various formats (e.g., grid, table) or with different sorting/filtering criteria.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space to which the list belongs
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The ID of the list to retrieve views for
parameters.name: list_id

parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The number of items to return
parameters.name: limit

200.description: The list of views associated with the specified list

get.description: Returns a paginated list of objects associated with a specific list (query or collection) within a space. When a view ID is provided, the objects are filtered and sorted according to the view's configuration. If no view ID is specified, all list objects are returned without filtering and sorting. This endpoint helps clients to manage grouped objects (for example, tasks within a list) by returning information for each item of the list.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space to which the list belongs
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The ID of the list to retrieve objects for
parameters.name: list_id

parameters.description: The ID of the view to retrieve objects for
parameters.name: view_id

parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The number of items to return
parameters.name: limit

200.description: The list of objects associated with the specified list

get.description: Returns a paginated list of members belonging to the specified space. Each member record includes the memberâ€™s profile ID, name, icon (which may be derived from an emoji or image), network identity, global name, status (e.g. joining, active) and role (e.g. Viewer, Editor, Owner). This endpoint supports collaborative features by allowing clients to show who is in a space and manage access rights.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space to list members for
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The number of items to return
parameters.name: limit

200.description: The list of members in the space

get.description: Fetches detailed information about a single member within a space. The endpoint returns the memberâ€™s identifier, name, icon, identity, global name, status and role. The member_id path parameter can be provided as either the member's ID (starting  with `_participant`) or the member's identity. This is useful for user profile pages, permission management, and displaying member-specific information in collaborative environments.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space to get the member from
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: Member ID or Identity
parameters.name: member_id

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of objects in the given space. The endpoint takes query parameters for pagination (offset and limit) and returns detailed data about each object including its ID, name, icon, type information, a snippet of the content (if applicable), layout, space ID, blocks and details. It is intended for building views where users can see all objects in a space at a glance.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space in which to list objects
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The number of items to return
parameters.name: limit

200.description: The list of objects in the specified space

post.description: Creates a new object in the specified space using a JSON payload. The creation process is subject to rate limiting. The payload must include key details such as the object name, icon, description, body content (which may support Markdown), source URL (required for bookmark objects), template identifier, and the type_key (which is the non-unique identifier of the type of object to create). Post-creation, additional operations (like setting featured properties or fetching bookmark metadata) may occur. The endpoint then returns the full object data, ready for further interactions.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space in which to create the object
parameters.name: space_id

delete.description: This endpoint â€œdeletesâ€ an object by marking it as archived. The deletion process is performed safely and is subject to rate limiting. It returns the objectâ€™s details after it has been archived. Proper error handling is in place for situations such as when the object isnâ€™t found or the deletion cannot be performed because of permission issues.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space in which the object exists
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The ID of the object to delete
parameters.name: object_id

get.description: Fetches the full details of a single object identified by the object ID within the specified space. The response includes not only basic metadata (ID, name, icon, type) but also the complete set of blocks (which may include text, files, properties and dataviews) and extra details (such as timestamps and linked member information). This endpoint is essential when a client needs to render or edit the full object view.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space in which the object exists
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The ID of the object to retrieve
parameters.name: object_id

parameters.description: The format to return the object body in
parameters.name: format

patch.description: This endpoint updates an existing object in the specified space using a JSON payload. The update process is subject to rate limiting. The payload must include the details to be updated. The endpoint then returns the full object data, ready for further interactions.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space in which the object exists
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The ID of the object to update
parameters.name: object_id

requestBody.description: The details of the object to update

get.description: âš  Warning: Properties are experimental and may change in the next update. âš  Retrieves a paginated list of properties available within a specific space. Each property record includes its unique identifier, name and format. This information is essential for clients to understand the available properties for filtering or creating objects.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space to list properties for
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The number of items to return
parameters.name: limit

200.description: The list of properties in the specified space

post.description: âš  Warning: Properties are experimental and may change in the next update. âš  Creates a new property in the specified space using a JSON payload. The creation process is subject to rate limiting. The payload must include property details such as the name and format. The endpoint then returns the full property data, ready for further interactions.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space to create the property in
parameters.name: space_id

delete.description: âš  Warning: Properties are experimental and may change in the next update. âš  This endpoint â€œdeletesâ€ a property by marking it as archived. The deletion process is performed safely and is subject to rate limiting. It returns the propertyâ€™s details after it has been archived. Proper error handling is in place for situations such as when the property isnâ€™t found or the deletion cannot be performed because of permission issues.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space to which the property belongs
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The ID of the property to delete
parameters.name: property_id

get.description: âš  Warning: Properties are experimental and may change in the next update. âš  Fetches detailed information about one specific property by its ID. This includes the propertyâ€™s unique identifier, name and format. This detailed view assists clients in showing property options to users and in guiding the user interface (such as displaying appropriate input fields or selection options).

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space to which the property belongs
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The ID of the property to retrieve
parameters.name: property_id

patch.description: âš  Warning: Properties are experimental and may change in the next update. âš  This endpoint updates an existing property in the specified space using a JSON payload. The update process is subject to rate limiting. The payload must include the name to be updated. The endpoint then returns the full property data, ready for further interactions.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space to which the property belongs
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The ID of the property to update
parameters.name: property_id

get.description: This endpoint retrieves a paginated list of tags available for a specific property within a space. Each tag record includes its unique identifier, name, and color. This information is essential for clients to display select or multi-select options to users when they are creating or editing objects. The endpoint also supports pagination through offset and limit parameters.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space to list tags for
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The ID of the property to list tags for
parameters.name: property_id

post.description: This endpoint creates a new tag for a given property id in a space. The creation process is subject to rate limiting. The tag is identified by its unique identifier within the specified space. The request must include the tag's name and color. The response includes the tag's details such as its ID, name, and color. This is useful for clients when users want to add new tag options to a property.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space to create the tag in
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The ID of the property to create the tag for
parameters.name: property_id

delete.description: This endpoint â€œdeletesâ€ a tag by marking it as archived. The deletion process is performed safely and is subject to rate limiting. It returns the tagâ€™s details after it has been archived. Proper error handling is in place for situations such as when the tag isnâ€™t found or the deletion cannot be performed because of permission issues.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space to delete the tag from
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The ID of the property to delete the tag for
parameters.name: property_id

parameters.description: The ID of the tag to delete
parameters.name: tag_id

get.description: This endpoint retrieves a tag for a given property id. The tag is identified by its unique identifier within the specified space. The response includes the tag's details such as its ID, name, and color. This is useful for clients to display or when editing a specific tag option.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space to retrieve the tag from
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The ID of the property to retrieve the tag for
parameters.name: property_id

parameters.description: The ID of the tag to retrieve
parameters.name: tag_id

patch.description: This endpoint updates a tag for a given property id in a space. The update process is subject to rate limiting. The tag is identified by its unique identifier within the specified space. The request must include the tag's name and color. The response includes the tag's details such as its ID, name, and color. This is useful for clients when users want to edit existing tags for a property.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space to update the tag in
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The ID of the property to update the tag for
parameters.name: property_id

parameters.description: The ID of the tag to update
parameters.name: tag_id

post.description: Performs a focused search within a single space (specified by the space_id path parameter). Like the global search, it accepts pagination parameters and a JSON payload containing the search query, object types, and sorting preferences. The search is limited to the provided space and returns a list of objects that match the query. This allows clients to implement spaceâ€‘specific filtering without having to process extraneous results.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space to search in
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The number of items to return
parameters.name: limit

requestBody.description: The search parameters used to filter and sort the results

200.description: The list of objects matching the search criteria

get.description: This endpoint retrieves a paginated list of object types (e.g. 'Page', 'Note', 'Task') available within the specified space. Each typeâ€™s record includes its unique identifier, type key, display name, icon, and layout. While a type's id is truly unique, a type's key can be the same across spaces for known types, e.g. 'page' for 'Page'. Clients use this information when offering choices for object creation or for filtering objects by type through search.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space to retrieve types from
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The number of items to return
parameters.name: limit

post.description: Creates a new object type in the specified space using a JSON payload. The creation process is subject to rate limiting. The payload must include type details such as the name, icon, and layout. The endpoint then returns the full type data, ready to be used for creating objects.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space in which to create the type
parameters.name: space_id

delete.description: This endpoint â€œdeletesâ€ an object type by marking it as archived. The deletion process is performed safely and is subject to rate limiting. It returns the typeâ€™s details after it has been archived. Proper error handling is in place for situations such as when the type isnâ€™t found or the deletion cannot be performed because of permission issues.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space from which to delete the type
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The ID of the type to delete
parameters.name: type_id

get.description: Fetches detailed information about one specific object type by its ID. This includes the typeâ€™s unique key, name, icon, and layout. This detailed view assists clients in understanding the expected structure and style for objects of that type and in guiding the user interface (such as displaying appropriate icons or layout hints).

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space from which to retrieve the type
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The ID of the type to retrieve
parameters.name: type_id

patch.description: This endpoint updates an existing object type in the specified space using a JSON payload. The update process is subject to rate limiting. The payload must include the name and properties to be updated. The endpoint then returns the full type data, ready for further interactions.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space in which the type exists
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The ID of the type to update
parameters.name: type_id

get.description: This endpoint returns a paginated list of templates that are associated with a specific object type within a space. Templates provide preâ€‘configured structures for creating new objects. Each template record contains its identifier, name, and icon, so that clients can offer users a selection of templates when creating objects.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space to which the type belongs
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The ID of the object type to retrieve templates for
parameters.name: type_id

parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The number of items to return
parameters.name: limit

get.description: Fetches full details for one template associated with a particular object type in a space. The response provides the templateâ€™s identifier, name, icon, and any other relevant metadata. This endpoint is useful when a client needs to preview or apply a template to prefill object creation fields.

parameters.description: The version of the API to use
parameters.name: Anytype-Version

parameters.description: The ID of the space to which the template belongs
parameters.name: space_id

parameters.description: The ID of the object type to which the template belongs
